body_html: @gunan not sure if you were referring to this, but part of this ticket is about not just new docker images, but also updating the TF kernels to take advantage of the new features in cuDNN 6. For example, pyTorch uses cuDNN 6 for dilated convolutions.
body_text: @gunan not sure if you were referring to this, but part of this ticket is about not just new docker images, but also updating the TF kernels to take advantage of the new features in cuDNN 6. For example, pyTorch uses cuDNN 6 for dilated convolutions.
body: @gunan not sure if you were referring to this, but part of this ticket is about not just new docker images, but also updating the TF kernels to take advantage of the new features in cuDNN 6. For example, [pyTorch uses cuDNN 6 for dilated convolutions](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/8aa1cefed880e3ad1a839bdbdc9d1fb9d52f5af3/torch/nn/_functions/conv.py#L81-L82).
